result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob O Leszczynski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Reckless Homicide/Deliver Drugs, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $5,313.66 payable to victim's parents Linda L. and Richard L.  Payable through Milwaukee County Clerk of Court's office.  To be  collected by DOC from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) Wis. stats and during Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Pay DNA surcharge, all other applicable costs, surcharges and assessments.  To be collected by DOC from 25% of prison funds and to convert to civl judgment upon release to Extended Supervision, but to remain a condition of Extended Supervision.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain fulltime employment.  Obtain high school diploma or GED.  Vocational/educational training.
No drugs.  No contact with drug community, coactor Michell Picord or victim's family.
Alcohol and drug assessment. Comply with recommended treatment. Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and imposed the mandatory surcharge.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms and body armor; and that he may not vote  until civil rights are restored.

Stat. Rule 809.21 (1).

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jacob O Leszczynski in court with attorney Matt Ricci.  Defendant Jacob O Leszczynski in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Presentence Investigation reviewed.  Additions and corrections made.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by Linda L., Richard L. and Steven L.
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 30 YEARS  consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 20 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 10 YEARS.  Conditions of extended supervision:
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
*Random urine screens.
*No drugs.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with co-actor Michell Picord and victim's family
*Seek and maintain fulltime employment
*Obtain high school diploma or GED
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy
*Vocational/educational training
*Restitution to victim's parents, Linda L. and Richard L., in the sum of 5,313.66 payable through Milwaukee County Clerk of Courts office
*Pay all costs and surcharges

Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and imposed mandatory surcharges.
The Court ordered the defendant to pay DNA surcharge AND all other applicable costs and any other surcharges and assessments to be collected by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds and to convert to civil judgment upon release to extended supervision but remain a condition of extended supervision.  

Restitution is to be collected by the DOC from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b), Wis. Stats. and during extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court informs defendant he is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms and body armor and that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into to the custody of the MIlwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Filed,
- Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
- Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief (filed in 14CF4889);

Court ordered presentence investigation. Order for presentence investigation filed; copy to Probation Dept.  
Case adjourned to 7-24-2015 at 8:30 a.m. for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 10.

Defendant Jacob O Leszczynski in court with attorney Matt Ricci.  Defendant Jacob O Leszczynski in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Calendar call scheduled for July 17, 2015 at 05:00 pm.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Matt Ricci in court, defendant Jacob O Leszczynski not in court, in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 10.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Matt Ricci in court, defendant Jacob O Leszczynski not in court, in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for scheduling conference in Branch 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jacob O Leszczynski in court with attorney Matt Ricci.  Defendant Jacob O Leszczynski in custody not produced.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.  Defense counsel still awaiting additional discovery. State's motion for protective order not objected by defense and granted by the Court.  Court ordered defendant's other pending case 14CF4889 transferred to Branch 10.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference, Branch 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
State's Motion for a Protective Order Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes 971.23(6) filed.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.
Protective Order filed.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Dugan, Br. 10.

Defendant Jacob O Leszczynski in court with attorney Matt Ricci.  Defendant Jacob O Leszczynski in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee County District Attorney's Office Investigator Robert Stelter.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jacob O Leszczynski in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Jacob O Leszczynski in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
